reviewText: This quiet, reflective film is a meditation on how members of a family together and individually grieve the loss of their beloved matriarch. I appreciated the scenes depicting the undertaker and funeral industry, a side of death rarely observed or discussed in American culture. Gorgeous cinematography and superb performances by Robert Graham and cast make this independent feature a real gem.
I saw this movie at the LA film festival.  It was such a beautiful story of a family supporting each other during a trying time.  I'm excited to see it again.  I highly recommend this movie.
This is a beautiful film about love and loss and family. Amazing cinematography, brilliant acting, and and absolutely touching heartfelt story.

Long and dragged out story of one man's dealing with grief.  As a chaplain, I worked with people dealing with grief for many years, so the process was not new to me.  Otherwise, if one is interested in understanding the process, this movie a good study on dealing with grief in a time of loss. It would also be a very good movie to use as a discussion group topical study.
Simple, short story on death and how it affects family.
Slower than molasses....cold molasses, but we couldn't stop watching it either.  Get ya Kleenex ready!!!!!!
So realistic!  ... Very emotional, the professionalism in the attention to detail in the processing of someone recently passed was very well done.
I just couldn't understand why some scenes were necessary to portray this man's loss of his wife. Seemed very obtuse to me.
This movie hits hard, but could have a better story line.
A FLOP
Too slow.
I COULD NOT  ENJOY THIS MOVIE
Very poor quality with no real story other than a man's wife dying and he just stands there with the funeral home rep staring at her. Terrible writing and acting.

Anybody who rates this movie higher than one star should pull their head out of their posterior. HORRIBLE. The only reason I do not use curse words is because my review may not get published. TERRIBLE. If you wasted your precious time watching this, I just could not live with myself. God-awful! Unfortunately, I cannot rate this with ZERO Stars. That is most certainly what the quality of the movie and 'storytelling' would dictate. TOTAL GARBAGE.
too slow but quite informative for someone who has never experienced death of a loved one

I prefer movies that either make me feel good, or make me think. This one did the latter. I don't see death as a horrible occurrence, my faith tells me it is simply a passage. But if death is hard for you, if it depresses you, then I wouldn't recommend this.
One of the most delicate films I have seen.  It was fairly easily watchable, now in my 60s.  10 or 20 years ago, it would have wrecked me, I am sure.
